text:
Hi,
I created a basic version of my webpage using Franklin in Julia. The github repo is here:
<https://github.com/sumitrmishra/sumitrmishra.github.io>
Now, I made some changes locally to the webpage, but I am unable to deploy these changes. I used `publish()` from within REPL, but that doesn't show up on gh-pages.
What am I missing? Apologies for such a trivial question.

Warm regards,
Sumit

elements.text:
Hi,
I created a basic version of my webpage using Franklin in Julia. The github repo is here:
Now, I made some changes locally to the webpage, but I am unable to deploy these changes. I used
publish()

from within REPL, but that doesn't show up on gh-pages.
What am I missing? Apologies for such a trivial question.

Warm regards,
Sumit

text: I'm not sure but it seems like you only have a master branch but it should push to the dev branch as it is a personal and not a project site?

elements.text: I'm not sure but it seems like you only have a master branch but it should push to the dev branch as it is a personal and not a project site?

text: Thanks, Ole, for your suggestion. I changed the branch to develop branch, but this didn't fix the problem. When I first did this in November, switching from master to gh-pages worked pretty well, but now it seems that I just cannot get my changes deployed to gh-pages.

<https://github.com/sumitrmishra/sumitrmishra.github.io>
Now, I made some changes locally to the webpage, but I am unable to deploy these changes. I used `publish()` from within REPL, but that doesn't show up on gh-pages.

Now, I made some changes locally to the webpage, but I am unable to deploy these changes. I used

Thanks, Ole, for your suggestion. I changed the branch to develop branch, but this didn't fix the problem. When I first did this in November, switching from master to gh-pages worked pretty well, but now it seems that I just cannot get my changes deployed to gh-pages.
It should be
dev
not
develop

text: My blog isn't on GitHub though, so others can probably help you out more. <@UDP5WL2RX> :slightly_smiling_face: ?

elements.text: My blog isn't on GitHub though, so others can probably help you out more.

text: <@U01HTF2S04D> since you use GitHub you don't have to use `publish` , just let the GitHub action deploy your website (when you push changes)

elements.text: since you use GitHub you don't have to use
publish
, just let the GitHub action deploy your website (when you push changes)

text: your github action fails because it seems you use a fairly old one, please replace yours with the updated one --> <https://github.com/tlienart/FranklinTemplates.jl/blob/master/src/templates/common/.github/workflows/deploy.yml>

elements.text: your github action fails because it seems you use a fairly old one, please replace yours with the updated one -->

text: finally make sure that in your repository settings, the branch `gh-pages` is selected as the source for the github pages deployment (this may already be the case but you should check)

elements.text: finally make sure that in your repository settings, the branch
gh-pages
is selected as the source for the github pages deployment (this may already be the case but you should check)
